other_tests.findings: Coronary arteries and left ventricular function were completely normal. Coronary intravascular ultrasound showed no significant subangiographic disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Symptoms continued to deteriorate over the ensuing months.

other_tests.findings: Showed 4 asymptomatic episodes of gastroesophageal reflux without associated ECG changes.
Transient ST-segment depression detected during monitoring, usually associated with tachycardia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: It was noted that 20% of the episodes of ST-segment depression occurred with a heart rate of 110-180 bpm.

other_tests.findings: Reduced to 1.3%, indicating systemic endothelial dysfunction.
Showed no regional wall motion abnormalities despite the occurrence of ST-segment depression and chest pain.
Borderline positive, with upsloping ST-segment depression but without chest pain.
